approach of the Government has also affected the growth and earnings of the

Net Worth* (Rs in lacs)
the Government for this sector has also discouraged the Indian industry from
making any investments in developing the export market, which you will appreciate
is highly competitive and dominated by major global corporations. With the capacity
and skill available within the industry, we are confident that Indian companies can
gain a respectable share in international trade and enhance the country's export
earnings manifold with the desired support from the Government. Brazil and China
are classic examples as they have achieved a significant presence in the globa
market with their consistent efforts in that direction. The Government must focus its
attention urgently to the need of the industry by providing an environment in which
it can adequately grow and face global competition within and outside the country.
There is an imminent need to rationalize the tax structure whereby the wide
differential in the taxation of various tobacco products inter-se is gradually reduced
and the States are discouraged from levying tax on cigarettes indiscriminately
and differentially. This can be resolved by having a single point of taxation in a
harmonized tax structure across the country.
TECHNICAL DEVELOPMENT AND ASSISTANCE TO FARMERS
* Excluding Revaluation Reserve
Having identified the potential of tobacco in India, your company has been making
investments in modernizing its manufacturing facilities and development of new
varieties of cigarette products. We also voluntarily started imparting training and
providing technology to the farmers of flue cured tobaccos in Andhra and
Karnataka to help them improve their yields, grow right varieties of tobacco and
follow superior farming practices including grading and packing of tobacco. The
